intro: Salvia lachnaioclada, commonly known as the woolly sage, is a perennial shrub native to the mountainous regions of South America. It is characterized by its silver-gray, woolly foliage and spikes of violet-blue flowers that bloom in summer. The plant is part of the Lamiaceae family, known for its aromatic properties and medicinal uses. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a suitable candidate for rock gardens and xeriscaping. Its unique appearance and hardy nature make it a popular choice among gardeners seeking drought-resistant plants.
